snippet: Four years after warning that ballet is dying, a historian has founded a center at New York University that will enlist arts professionals and scholars to examine its future.
abstract: Dancer turned historian Jennifer Homans is set to open the Center for Ballet and the Arts at New York University, organization that will establish ballet as serious subject of academic inquiry and weigh ballet's past, present and future; center seeks to invigorate art form following Homans' assertion that ballet is dying.
lead_paragraph: Four years after warning that ballet is dying, a historian has founded a center at New York University that will enlist arts professionals and scholars to examine its future.

headline.seo: New Center at N.Y.U. Focuses on Dance and the Arts
headline.main: Think Tank to Ponder a Future for Ballet
headline.print_headline: Think Tank to Ponder a Future for Ballet
